article.headline: Pepperdine 82, American 69
article.story: HONOLULU (AP) -- Alex Ackers had 16 points to lead the Pepperdine Waves over American 82-69 Sunday night in the first round of the Rainbow Classic. Terrance Johnson scored 13 points for Pepperdine (5-6), while Jesse Pinegar and Chase Griffin added in 12 and 10, respectively. Andre Ingram led American (3-7) with 19 points, going 5-of-12 from 3-point range. Linas Lekavicius scored 14 points off the bench and Jernavis Draughn had 11 as American lost its third straight game. Johnson scored six points in a 9-2 Pepperdine run to start the second half to put the Waves up 50-26. American tried to rally and closed the deficit to 15 twice with less than eight minutes remaining. But the Waves' man-to-man defense proved impenetrable as American hit just 35 percent (23-of-66) from the field and was 9-of-29 from 3-point range. The Waves shot 61 percent for the night (31-of-51) but turned the ball over 21 times.
